params.name: campaignId
params.doc: ID of the campaign to archive.

docs.summary: Marks a campaign as archived
For internal use.

params.name: templateId
params.doc: ID of the template to fork.

docs.summary:
Creates a new draft campaign from a specified template.
It can be accessed from TemplateService by tag, or you can ask your designer.

params.name: templateId
params.doc: ID of the template to fork.

docs.summary: Used by verticals that need to create automations that are already enabled.
Deletes a campaign (cannot be undone).
Retrieves information about an email campaign.
get campaign mapping for automation
For internal use.
get campaign mapping for ping
Returns a list of email campaigns. These are always ordered by `date_updated` in descending order.
Retrieves a list of recipients for a selected campaign based on a specific recipient activity.
description:
Pages are returned with a maximum of 1,000 recipients per page and defaults to 40 recipients per page.

Use [List Statistics](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/marketing/email-marketing/campaign/list-statistics) to retrieve a list of activity for selected campaigns.
Use [List Campaigns](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/marketing/email-marketing/campaign/list-campaigns) to retrieve additional information for your campaigns.

> __Note__: If no `activity` is included, this endpoint returns an error.

params.name: campaignIds
params.doc:
IDs of the campaigns to retrieve.

Max: 100 campaigns

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of statistics for up to 100 selected campaigns.
description:
For each campaign, you receive the total activity count for the campaign's landing page and email. For example, the total
amount of times the landing page was opened, or the total amount of email recipients that clicked a link in an email.

Use [List Campaigns](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/marketing/email-marketing/campaign/list-campaigns) to retrieve additional information for your campaigns.
Use [List Recipients](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/marketing/email-marketing/campaign/list-recipients) to retrieve a list of recipients and their activities related to a selected campaign.

docs.summary: Pauses a scheduled campaign. Learn more about [market campaign scheduling](https://support.wix.com/en/article/managing-your-scheduled-email-marketing-campaign).

params.name: campaignId
params.doc: ID of the campaign to preview.

docs.summary: Build an HTML preview of the campaign. Useful if you need to show the user what their email will look like.

Publishes/sends a specified campaign.
If `email_distribution_options` are not supplied, the campaign is only published as a landing page.

query automation templates from "action-triggers-server" (enriched with campaignId and metaSiteId)
https://github.com/wix-private/crm/blob/master/action-triggers-server/action-triggers-integrator-idl/src/main/proto/services/AutomationTemplatesService.proto#L100
NOTE: it does not support multi-step automations - enrichment will happen for the first shoutout template id found

params.name: campaignId
params.doc: ID of the campaign to resend.

docs.summary: Resends a copy of campaign to users that did not open it. Different subject line may be used for the new campaign if necessary.

params.name: campaignId
params.doc: ID of the message to be duplicated.

docs.summary: Creates a (draft) copy of an existing campaign.
Sends a test email for preview purposes. It is heavily throttled - do not use this for regular campaign sending.

params.name: campaignId
params.doc: ID of the campaign to unarchive.

docs.summary: Marks a campaign as active

params.name: campaignId
params.doc: ID of the campaign to change title of.

docs.summary: Changes title of the campaign

members.name: _id
members.doc: the id of the action for delayed events

members.name: actionConfig
actionKey
members.doc: Identifier for this action - human readable action key - unique per app def id

members.name: appId
members.doc: the id of the app defining the action

members.name: delay
members.doc: Optional delay configuration for the action

members.name: outputActionConfig
members.doc:
output mapping expression for the action output
for example in get-contact action:
`{ "author": "{{$}}" }`
This will map the entire entity of contact under `author` namespace

members.name: rateLimit
members.doc: allows you define an activation policy - like number of activations in a time frame, or limit by some identifier, like contact (e.g. send email to user only at first login)

members.doc: Action configuration

members.name: delayIntervalSec
members.doc: Delay interval in seconds

members.name: activations
members.doc: number of activations allowed in the given time_frame

members.name: timeFrame
members.doc: set a time frame in minutes for the once_per_user attribute, use 0 for infinite

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: Campaign ID.

members.name: bounced
members.doc: Number of emails that bounced.

members.name: clicked
members.doc:
Number of recipients who clicked a link in the email.

If a single recipient clicks a link in an email twice, it is counted as one unique click.
If a single recipient clicks different links in an email, it is counted as one unique click.

members.name: complained
members.doc: Number of recipients who reported email as spam.

members.name: delivered
members.doc: Number of emails delivered.

members.name: notSent
members.doc: Number of emails not sent because the campaign was terminated.

members.name: opened
members.doc:
Number of recipients who opened an email.

If a single recipient opens an email twice, it is counted as one unique open.

members.name: activityType
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'CLICK'`
- `'DELIVERY'`
- `'HARD_BOUNCED'`
- `'OPEN'`
- `'SOFT_BOUNCE'`

members.name: campaignId

members.name: contactId
members.doc: [Contact ID](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) of recipient.

members.name: hardBounce
members.doc:
Email hard bounced when sent to a recipient.

Indicates a permanent error sending your email. For example, the email address does not exist.

members.name: open
members.doc: Recipient opened an email.

members.name: recipientEmailAddress
members.doc: Email address of recipient.

members.name: softBounce
members.doc:
Email soft bounced when sent to a recipient.

Indicates a temporary issue sending your email. For example, the email server receiving the email is under a heavy load.
For soft bounces, you should wait and try again at a later time.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Date and time of the event.

members.name: hardBounce
members.doc:
Email hard bounced when sent to a recipient.

Indicates a permanent error sending your email. For example, the email address does not exist.

members.name: open
members.doc: Recipient opened an email.

members.name: softBounce
members.doc:
Email soft bounced when sent to a recipient.

Indicates a temporary issue sending your email. For example, the email server receiving the email is under a heavy load.
For soft bounces, you should wait and try again at a later time.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency code. Must be valid ISO 4217 currency code (e.g., USD).

members.name: formattedValue
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string in local format (e.g., 1 000,30). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (e.g., 3.99). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

description:
Money.
Default format to use. Sufficiently compliant with majority of standards: w3c, ISO 4217, ISO 20022, ISO 8583:2003.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

paging

members.name: rejectionReasons
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ADULT_SEXUAL_CONTENT'`
- `'AFFILIATE_MARKETING'`
- `'BETTING_OR_GAMBLING'`
- `'CREDIT_REPAIR_OR_DEBT_RELIEF'`
- `'GET_RICH_QUICK_SCHEME'`
- `'ILLEGAL_SUBSTANCES_OR_WEAPONS'`
- `'LOW_ENGAGEMENT'`
- `'MISLEADING_SUBJECT_LINE'`
- `'OTHER'`
- `'SENDER_DETAILS'`
- `'SPAM_TRAPS'`
- `'TRADING_OR_CRYPTOCURRENCIES'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`
- `'UNSOLICITED_CONTENT'`

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign to unarchive.

members.name: dateFieldKey
members.doc: The key of the field in the trigger payload which contains the date to delay until

members.name: offset
members.doc: Optional: a delay to add together with the date described in the payload

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign to change title of.
